description: This course examines European history during the period of about 300 to 1000. Topics include the culture of late antiquity, the foundation of Christian institutions, the age of migrations, the Byzantine Empire and its relationship with the West, the emergence of Islam, the Carolingian revival, the manorial system, and the development of feudalism, with attention given to women's roles in medieval society throughout the course. Prerequisite: History 190 recommended. Offered alternate years.
name: Early Middle Ages

revisions.prerequisites: Prerequisite: History 190 recommended. Offered alternate years.

title: The Early Middle Ages
